meanings.definition: A person who reneges on a promise or commitment.
meanings.sent1: The reneger promised to help, but then backed out.
meanings.sent2: The reneger didn't keep their word about joining the team.
meanings.sent3: The reneger's change of heart left everyone surprised.
meanings.sent4: She was a reneger, a shadow of her former trustworthy self.
meanings.sent5: The reneger's actions spoke louder than any excuse.

meanings.definition: To fail to fulfill a promise or commitment.
meanings.sent1: He tends to reneger on his plans at the last minute.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a reneger; keep your promises.
meanings.sent3: The reneger's excuse for not showing up was quite creative.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to reneger on the deal cost her dearly.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of being a reneger can be severe.

meanings.definition: To go back on one's word.
meanings.sent1: She always seems to reneger on her agreements when things get tough.
meanings.sent2: It's not right to reneger on a promise you made.
meanings.sent3: The reneger's apology was met with skepticism.
meanings.sent4: He felt like a reneger after breaking his vow.
meanings.sent5: The decision to reneger haunted him for years.
